page.title: 01Kirkby-in-Ashfield Today
page.content: Kirkby is primarily a mining and industrial community,having a shopping centre at the junction of two major routes:theB6020 Kirkby Cross - Ravenshead,and B6021 Annesley-Sutton. Coal has been the backbone of the economy since the late 19th century, though the textile industry has been, and remains, important.Since the closing of Kirkby Colliery,there has been a substantial broadening of the industrial base.Collieries adjacent to the area have remained the largest source of jobs,with new industrial estates along the old railway and colliery sites. Central shops principally sell convenience goods and provide basic services. Outside the built-up area land uses are agriculture,forestry and mineral extraction,with 'pockets'of Green Belt
